conclusion: Identify the interval in which the block is sliding on the plate
At t=0, the block is at rest while the plate is moving to the right
The two surfaces are in relative motion and the only horizontal force on the block is the kinetic-friction force
On the v–t graph, this motion is the straight-line section starting at the origin and ending when the block and plate have the same speed
Velocity increases uniformly from 0 to 4.0 m/s in 2.0 s
Determine the acceleration of the block while it is sliding
For a straight-line portion of a v–t graph, the slope equals the constant acceleration
Relate acceleration to the coefficient of kinetic friction
During sliding, the horizontal force on the block is the kinetic-friction force Fₖ = μ₁ m g
Horizontal equation of motion: Fₖ = m a₁ ⇒ μ₁ m g = m a₁ ⇒ μ₁ = a₁ / g
Using g = 10 m/s² and a₁ = 2.0 m/s², μ₁ = 2.0 m/s² / 10 m/s² = 0.20
The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the plate is μ₁ = 0.20
